title: Ticket #6342: Memory leak during clean-up of an authenticated socket
description:

remarks:
2017-Jul-10 13:13:08 by bbockelm:
Fix looks good to me.

Since this issue is handled transparently on all known platforms, I'd suggest we don't need any mention in the release notes.

2017-Jul-11 10:25:13 by tim:
DOC REVIEW: No docs needed

2017-Jul-17 14:47:56 by jfrey:
This bug results in a memory leak, which may contribute noticeably to the growing memory usage of the collector in the CMS global pool that is currently under investigation.

2017-Jul-17 15:15:54 by bbockelm:
Why would it result in a memory leak?

I'd expect a memory leak if a "new []" was mismatched with a "free()" (i.e., array variant with non-array variant), but mismatching "new" and "free"?

(I mean, it's undefined behavior regardless...)

2017-Jul-17 15:44:00 by jfrey:
It's memory leak because it's a ClassAd that's being free()d. That means the destructor isn't called, so all data that's not in the base ClassAd structure is leaked.

2017-Jul-17 15:45:33 by bbockelm:
Ah yes, good point! That would be one potential cause, particularly places where many authenticated sockets are created.

2017-Jul-18 09:19:32 by tim:
This merits a version history entry.

2017-Jul-18 09:22:44 by bbockelm:
Agreed. Sorry for the incorrect original analysis; glad Jaime caught it!

2017-Jul-26 09:06:14 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good
